eu.cqse.check.framework.core.registry

Class CheckRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.core.registry.CheckRegistry

  • public class CheckRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    Registry singleton that manages custom checks.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static CheckRegistry getInstance()
        Returns the singleton instance.

      • registerChecksFromClasspathDirectory

        public void registerChecksFromClasspathDirectory(java.io.File classesDirectory)
        Registers the given bundle and loads all classes from the given bundle that implement CheckImplementationBase and are annotated with ACheck. Uses the current thread's class loader for loading the checks. This means the classes directory needs already on the class path.

      • registerCheckDirectory

        public void registerCheckDirectory(java.io.File customChecksDirectory)
        Searches the given directory for Jar files or classes directories containing custom checks. This supports registering Jars as well as compiled classes in a 'classes' directory (e.g. from an Eclipse project). Both are searched recursively, but whenever a folder contains a classes directory scanning for Jars and further classes directories is skipped. The restriction results from jar files being placed e.g by Gradle in the 'build' output of source projects, which would then be picked up and lead to problems. The same applies to the classes folder in the Gradle build output. The found jars and classes directories will be put on the classpath (using a separate classloader).

      • loadChecksFromJar

        public void loadChecksFromJar(java.io.File jarFile)
        Loads custom checks from the given Jar file.

      • instantiateChecks

        public java.util.Collection<CheckInstance> instantiateChecks(java.util.List<java.lang.String> identifiers,
                                                             ILogger logger)
                                                      throws CheckException
        Creates check instances for the given check identifiers.
        Throws:
        CheckException - if there is no check for one of the given identifiers

      • getChecksInfos

        public java.util.Collection<CheckInfo> getChecksInfos()
        Returns a list of all registered checks.
